column1: Table 1. Persons at work by telework status and selected characteristics, March 2025

column3: Persons who teleworked or worked at home for pay
column8: Persons who teleworked or worked at home for pay

column6: Persons who did not telework or work at home for pay
column11: Persons who did not telework or work at home for pay

column1: Race and Hispanic or Latino ethnicity
Less than a high school diploma

1 Data refer to persons who worked during the survey reference week regardless of telework status. Excludes employed persons absent from work the entire week due to holidays, vacation, illness, or other reasons.
2 Includes persons who teleworked for some but not all of their work hours.
3 Separated includes persons who are married, spouse absent.
4 Includes persons with a high school diploma or equivalent.
5 Includes persons with bachelor's, master's, professional, and doctoral degrees.

NOTE: Estimates for the race groups (White, Black or African American, and Asian) do not sum to totals because data are not presented for all races. Persons whose ethnicity is identified as Hispanic or Latino may be of any race. Data are not seasonally adjusted. Updated population controls are introduced annually with the release of January data.
